thread.title: Stronger Dollar, Higher Yields Weigh on Gold

author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Stronger Dollar, Higher Yields Weigh on Gold
text:
Gold prices fell Tuesday, hurt by a stronger dollar as investors monitored congressional testimony from new Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell.
Front-month gold for March delivery declined 1.1% to $1,315.50 a troy ounce on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have stayed between $1,310 and $1,360 in the past month, moving within that range based on swings in the dollar and concerns about higher interest rates.
...
